register.description: ATL IP revision. Value is hard wired and revised for each new IP release

bitfield.description: Identifies the ATL revision.

register.description: Parts per million register for the first ATL instance. This register is used by the adjusting circuit. The Parts-Per-Million Registers 0-2 (PPMRn) are used by the audio re-timing code to adjust the DAC clocking rate by changing the McASP clocks. The McASP high-speed clock slows down or speeds up by the PPM written to PPM_SETTING bits [8:0], which changes the DAC over-sampling clock or the frame sync and bit clocks.

bitfield.description: Part-Per-Million Slowdown
PPM_SETTING PPM adjustment = PPMR[8:0] ÷ 2

register.description: Baseband sample register for the first ATL instance.

bitfield.description: The measuring circuit produces a 16- bit Sample Count that is stored in the BBSR register. Its inputs are the Audio IIS Word Select (AWS) and the Baseband IIS Word Select (BWS) from their respective McASP pins.

register.description: ATL configuration register for first ATL instance.

bitfield.description: ATL Internal Divider. Sets ATLPCLK-to-ATCLK ratio. The ATL Internal Divider divides down the ATL master clock (ATLPCLK) to generate ATCLK.

register.description: Software enable bit for the first ATL instance. The audio tracking logic (ATL) must be held in reset while the AWS, BWS, and ATPCLK mux selections are set, and while the system level clocking is configured.

bitfield.description: Software enable bit. The software must enable this bit to enable the first ATL instance.

register.description: Select source for BWS input to first ATL instance. The ATL baseband word input can be connected to up to 15 different input sources. This register must be configured to set the McASP (or other input) desired for the first ATL instance.

bitfield.description: Baseband Word Select Mux. Selects the source for the BWS input to the first ATL instance.

register.description: Select source for AWS input to the first ATL instance. The ATL audio word input can be connected to up to 15 different input sources. This register must be configured to set the McASP (or other input) desired for the first ATL instance.

bitfield.description: Audio Word Select Mux. Selects the source for the AWS input to the first ATL instance.

register.description: Select source for ATLPCLK input to all four ATL instances. The ATL clock input can be driven from with the OCP_CLK or the ATLPCLK inputs. The ATLPCLK selection register determines the final clock source for the ATL core audio tracking logic. In most use cases this will be set to the ATLPCLK input to use the system clocks shown in the device specific data manual.

bitfield.description: ATLPCLK Selection Register Mux. Selects the source for the ATLPCLK input to all four ATL instances.

register.description: Parts per million register for the second ATL instance. This register is used by the adjusting circuit. The Parts-Per-Million Registers 0-2 (PPMRn) are used by the audio re-timing code to adjust the DAC clocking rate by changing the McASP clocks. The McASP high-speed clock slows down or speeds up by the PPM written to PPM_SETTING bits [8:0], which changes the DAC over-sampling clock or the frame sync and bit clocks.

bitfield.description: Part-Per-Million Slowdown
PPM_SETTING PPM adjustment = PPMR[8:0] ÷ 2

register.description: Baseband sample register for the second ATL instance.

bitfield.description: The measuring circuit produces a 16- bit Sample Count that is stored in the BBSR register. Its inputs are the Audio IIS Word Select (AWS) and the Baseband IIS Word Select (BWS) from their respective McASP pins.

register.description: ATL configuration register for the second ATL instance.

bitfield.description: ATL Internal Divider. Sets ATLPCLK-to-ATCLK ratio. The ATL Internal Divider divides down the ATL master clock (ATLPCLK) to generate ATCLK.

register.description: Software enable bit for the second ATL instance. The audio tracking logic (ATL) must be held in reset while the AWS, BWS, and ATPCLK mux selections are set, and while the system level clocking is configured.

bitfield.description: Software enable bit. The software must enable this bit to enable the second ATL instance.

register.description: Select source for BWS input to the second ATL instance. The ATL baseband word input can be connected to up to 15 different input sources. This register must be configured to set the McASP (or other input) desired for the second ATL instance.

bitfield.description: Baseband Word Select Mux. Selects the source for the BWS input to the second ATL instance.

register.description: Select source for AWS input to the second ATL instance. The ATL audio word input can be connected to up to 15 different input sources. This register must be configured to set the McASP (or other input) desired for the second ATL instance.

bitfield.description: Audio Word Select Mux. Selects the source for the AWS input to the second ATL instance.

register.description: Select source for ATLPCLK input to the second ATL instance. The ATL clock input can be driven from with the OCP_CLK or the ATLPCLK inputs. The ATLPCLK selection register determines the final clock source for the ATL core audio tracking logic. In most use cases this will be set to the ATLPCLK input to use the system clocks shown in the device specific data manual.

bitfield.description: ATLPCLK Selection Register Mux. Selects the source for the ATLPCLK input to the second ATL instance. (Not functional).

register.description: Software enable bit for the third ATL instance. The audio tracking logic (ATL) must be held in reset while the AWS, BWS, and ATPCLK mux selections are set, and while the system level clocking is configured.

register.description: Select source for BWS input to to the third ATL instance. The ATL baseband word input can be connected to up to 15 different input sources. This register must be configured to set the McASP (or other input) desired for the third ATL instance.

The ATLPCLK selection register determines the final clock source for the ATL core audio tracking logic. In most use cases this will be set to the ATLPCLK input to use the system clocks shown in the device specific data manual.

bitfield.description: ATLPCLK Selection Register Mux. Selects the source for the ATLPCLK input to the third instance. (Not functional).

The McASP high-speed clock slows down or speeds up by the PPM written to PPM_SETTING bits [8:0], which changes the DAC over-sampling clock or the frame sync and bit clocks.

The ATLPCLK selection register determines the final clock source for the ATL core audio tracking logic. In most use cases this will be set to the ATLPCLK input to use the system clocks shown in the device specific data manual.
